w:r.w:t: This lesson will focus on the alphabet, its individual letters, and how to spell words they have been learning in this Unit. Spelling words will be introduced to the student, and they will soon be able to comprehend the basics of words structure and spelli
At the completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Review and say the letters of the alphabet
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to be reviewing the letters of the alphabet and using them to spell different words.
Spell words that you learned in previous lessons.
Sing this song with the student to begin the lesson with excitement!
If you can, see if the student can sing it by themselves, too!
Remind students of different words they learned in the first lessons.
Test how they do with spelling different words (this can provide background knowledge).
Say and spell the different letters in the alphabet.
Review with the student the different letters of the alphabet. If the student is struggling with different letters, make sure to spend more time on them.
Complete the sentence frame: The word is “red.”
Say the word and spell the word red for the student. Have student repeat saying the word.
Have the student spell the word
Then, direct student to spell the word red, letter by letter on the screen or a separate piece of paper.
